Class Battles

java.lang.Object
Battles
public class Battles extends Object
This class implements a Battle between a team of monsters and an enemy.
Version:
1.4, Apr 2022.
Author:
Matthew Harper

  • Method Details

    • getBattles

      public ArrayList<Trainers> getBattles(int numBattles, Player player)
      Generates all the possible battles the player can fight in a day
      Parameters:
      numBattles - The number of battles the player wants to fight in a day
      player - The current stats of the player
      Returns:
      ArrayList An array list containing all the possible battles

    • printBattles

      public void printBattles(ArrayList<Trainers> possibleBattles)
      Prints the possible battles the player can fight in a day
      Parameters:
      possibleBattles - An array containing all the possible battles.

    • fight

      public boolean fight(Team friends, Monster badGuy, Inventory playerInventory, Scanner action)
      Battles your team of Monsters with an enemy Monster the battle continues until either the player is out of Monsters or the enemy is dead gets user input to allow the user to switch which monster is fighting, heal itself, use items, fight or switch the team positions around. Returns true if the player still has a living team at the end of the battle. Returns false if all the players monsters are dead by the end of the battle.
      Parameters:
      friends - The current team of Monsters the Player has
      badGuy - The enemy the player is fighting

    • attack

      public void attack(Monster friend, Monster badGuy, Team friends, boolean evenFight)
      Gets called when the user inputs "attack". Checks the effectiveness of the current attack then multiplies the damage by that If the attack is one sided (aka the friend is either healing, switching or using an item) then only the enemy attack as the player has already used their turn.
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend that does the attack
      badGuy - The enemy that responds to the attack
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has
      evenFight - Used to check if the fight is one sided or not

    • swap

      public void swap(Monster badGuy, Team friends, Scanner scanner)
      Gets called when the user inputs "switch". Gets the user to input the position of the first and second monster they want to switch then switches their positions Checks that the numbers are in a valid range else will ask the user to input another valid command Also checks that the monster you are trying to swap is not currently dead After the switch happens the Monster that is now at the front of the team will get attacked.
      Parameters:
      badGuy - The enemy that attacks while the switch is happening
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has

    • heal

      public void heal(Monster friend, Monster badGuy, Team friends, Scanner healNumber)
      Gets called when the user inputs "heal". Allows the monster in position 1 to heal any monster (including itself) in the team This will use the players turn and cause a one sided attack by the enemy monster against the friend Checks that the index of the monster to heal is in a valid range else will ask the user to input another valid command
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend that does the healing
      badGuy - The enemy that attacks while the healing is happening
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has
      healNumber - The scanner used to get input

    • useItem

      public void useItem(Team friends, Monster badGuy, Inventory playerInventory, Scanner itemNumber)
      Gets called when the user inputs "items". Allows the use of any items currently in the players bag This will use the players turn and cause a one sided attack by the enemy monster against the friend Checks that both the item index and the Monster index is in a valid range else asks for a different input
      Parameters:
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has
      badGuy - The enemy that attacks while the item is being used
      playerInventory - The current inventory of the player
      itemNumber - The scanner used to get input

    • checkFriendsHealth

      public boolean checkFriendsHealth(Monster friend, Team friends)
      Checks the health of the friend. If the health of the friend is less than or equal to 0 it removes the friend from the team. Returns false if the friend is dead or returns true if it's still alive.
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend that is being checked
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has

    • checkEnemysHealth

      public boolean checkEnemysHealth(Monster badGuy, Monster friend, Team friends)
      Checks the health of an enemy. If the health of the enemy is less than or equal to 0 it returns false else returns true.
      Parameters:
      badGuy - The enemy that is being checked
      friend - The friend that will gain the experience at the end of the battle
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has

    • printEnemyAndTeamStats

      public void printEnemyAndTeamStats(Monster badGuy, Team friends)
      Prints the stats of both the enemy and the players team. If the health of the enemy is less than or equal to 0 it returns false else returns true.
      Parameters:
      badGuy - The enemy that stats get printed
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has

    • speedAttacks

      public void speedAttacks(Monster friend, Monster badGuy, Team friends, double friendAttackMultiplier, double enemyAttackMultiplier)
      Considers the speed of the enemy and friend before performing an attack. The monster with the fastest speed will attack first. If the Monster that gets attacked first dies then the other monster does not get attacked.
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend that will attack first if its speed is faster than the enemy
      badGuy - The enemy that will attack first if its speed is faster than the friend
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has
      attackMultiplier - The amount that the attack will be multiplied by.

    • oneSidedAttack

      public void oneSidedAttack(Monster friend, Monster badGuy, Team friends, double enemyAttackMultiplier)
      Performs a one sided attack so that only the badGuy gets to attack the friend. This only gets called when the user wastes their turn healing, using an item or switching. Considers the type of attack (e.g. super effective) to scale the damage appropriately.
      Parameters:
      friend - The friend that will be attacked by the enemy
      badGuy - The enemy that will attack the friend
      friends - The current team of monsters the player has
      attackMultiplier - The amount that the attack will be multiplied by.

    • monsterTypeToIndex

      public int monsterTypeToIndex(String type)
      Returns the respective index of the type of monster from the howEffective array in class Monster. Returns 0 for type Fire, 1 for type Water, 2 for type Grass, 3 for type glass and 4 for type Medical
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the Monster.
      Returns:
      int an integer representation of the type of monster

    • howEffective

      public double howEffective(Monster attacker, Monster attacked)
      Checks how effective a type of attack is using the matrix howEffective in class Monster. e.g if a fire monster attacks a grass monster then the attack will be super effective so * 2.
      Parameters:
      attacker - The Monster that is doing the attack.
      attacked - The Monster that is being attacked.
      Returns:
      double returns how effective an attack is on a monster
